provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. These Rules may be cited as the Designs Rules. 1937.                        CI~~IOU
                                                                                          and inter-
                                                                                          prctation.
           In these Rules. unless the context otherwise requires-
             "agent" meana an agent resident in the Island;
             "office" means the office of the Registrar of Companies;
             "specimen" means an article of manufacture or a substance with
                  the design applied for;
             "lodged" means left at the office or sent through the post by
                  prepaid letter addressed to the Registrar at the office;
             "set" means a number of articles of the same general character
                  ordinarily on sale together or intended to be used together,
                  all bearing the same design, with or without modifications
                  or variations not sufficient to alter the character or substantially
                  to affect the identity thereof.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. The fees to be paid in relation to designs shaU be those prescribed. , F
                                                                                     Fira
         in the First Schedule.                                                     Schodula.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. For the purposes of the registration of designs and of these Rules c ~ . a l l i ~ d ~ ~
         goods are classified in the manner set out in the Third Schedule. $?"'
                                                                                          Schcdula.
                                        THE DESIGNS RULES, 1937
                   If any doubt arises as to the class to which any particular description
                of goods belongs, it shall be determined by the Registrar.
SLc, etc.. of      6. Subject to other directions that may be given by the Registrar.
documents.
                all applications, notices. papers having representations affixed
                and other documents required by the Act or by these Rules to be
                lodged shall be upon strong paper. and except where otherwise required,
                on one side only, of a size of approximately 13 inches by 8 inches and
                having on the left-hand part thereof a margin of approximately two           b
                inches.
S&natun of        7. A document lodged by a partnership or firm shall contain the
documents.
                names of the partners in full and shall be signed by all the partners.
                A document lodged by a body corporate shall be signed by a director
                or by the secretary or other principal officer of such body corporate.
                A document lodged by an approved society as defined in the Act shall
                be signed by the secretary of such society.
Service of        8. Any application, statement, notice or other document authorized
documents.
                or required to be lodged or to be left. made or given with or to any
                person under the Act or these Rules may be sent through the post
                by a prepaid letter; any document so sent shall be deemed to have
                been delivered at the time when the letter containing the same would
                be delivered in the ordinary course of post, and in proving such service
                or sending, it shall be sufl[icient to prove that the letter was properly
                addressed and put into the post.

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9. Where any person is bound to furnish the Registrar with
                an address, the address given shall in all cases be full as possible, for
                the purpose of enabling any person easily to fmd the place of business
                of the person whose address is given.
Address for       10. Every applicant in any proceedings to which these Rules relate.
scdce.
                and every person registered as proprietor of. a registered design, shall
                furnish to the Registrar, in addition to his full residential or
                business address, an address for service in this Island. Such address
                may be treated, for all purposes connected with such proceedings or
                design, as the actual address of such applicant or person and shall, in
                the case of a registered proprietor, be entered on the Register as the
                address for s e ~ m of such proprietor.
                           THE DBSIGNS RUL&S. 1937
      Any written communication addressed to an applicant in any
    proceedings, or to any person registered as proprietor of, a registered
    design at his address for servia shall be deemed to be properly
    addressed.
       Where an address for service has not been furnished to the Registrar.
    the Registrar may treat the residential or business address as the ad-
    dress for s t ~ a  unless
                         ,    such residential or business address is out the
    Island, in which case the Registrar need not proceed with the examha-
    tion of the application until an address for service in the Island has been
    furnished to him.
      l t An application for registration and all other communications m.
    between an applicant and the Registrar, and between the registered pro-
    prietor of a d d g n and the Registrar, or any other perm, may be made
    by or through an agent.
      Any such applicant or proprietor may appoint an agent to represent
    him in the matter of the design by signing and sending to the Registrar
    an authority in writing to that effect on Form Designs No. 1 P-
    or in such other form as the Registrar may d a m sufficient.
    In case any registered proprietor of a design shall appoint such an
                                                                                  *
    agent, &a upon such agent of any document relating to such
    design shall be deemed to be s e m a upon the person so appointing
    hi and all communications directed to be made to such person in
    respect of such design may be addressed to such agent.
      The Registrar shall not be bound to recogah as such
    agmt or to receive further cbmmdcations in respect of any business
    under the Act from any person who has been guilty of conduct discredit-
    able to such an agent, or any company, which if it had been an
    individual, the Registrar could refuse to ncogdze as an agent,
    or any company or firm, if any person whom the Registrar
    could refuse to reco~izeas an agent acts as director or manager
    of the company or is a partner in the firm. In any particular casc.
    the Registrar may. if he tbinka fit, require the personal signature
    or presena of an applicant or other person.
      1 2 An application for registration of a design shall be signed by s+-o~
                                                                         apphcrrion.
    the applicant for registration or by his agent.
i
    che aflim and shall be on Form D d i No. 2 or in tbe cam d a
    set on Form Designs No. 3.                                            E!#Y.N"-

                         THE DESlGNS RULES, 1937
                                    T i r l ~ DSCHEDULE                      (Rule 5 )
                           C L A S S I ~ I G ~or-
                                               O NGOODS
Class  1.-Articles composed wholly of metal or in which metal predominates.
           and jewellery.
Clars 2.-Books and bookbinding of all .materials.
Class 3.-Articles    composed wholly of wood, bone. ivory, papier mache or
           other solid substances not included in other classes, or of materials
           in which such substances predominate.
Class 4.-Articles composed wholly of glass, earthenware, or porcelain, clay
           (burnt or baked), or cement or in which such materials predominate.
Class 5.-Articles composed wholly of paper. card-board, mill-board or straw-
           board (except articles included in Class 2, and paper-hangings), or
           in which such materials predominate.
Class 6.-Articles composed wholly of leather or in which leather predominates.
           not included in other classes.
Class 7.-Paper hangings.
Class 8.--Carpets, rugs and Boor coverings in all materials.
Class 9.-Lace.
Class 10.-Boots and shoes.
Class 11.-Millinery and wearing apparel (exccpt boots and shoes).
Class 12.-Goods not included in other classes.
Clau 13.-Printed or woven designs on textile piece goods (other than checks
           or stripes).
Class 14.-Printed or wovcn deigns on handkerchiefs and shawls (other than
           checks or stripes).
Unss 15.-Printed or woven designs on textile piece goods or on handkerchiefs
           or shawls being checks or stripes.
Clans 16.-Ornamental needlework on muslin o r linen or other textile fabrics.

provisions.title: Section 12
provisions.content:
12. On application for search under section 9
                when registmtbn number is not supplied ...                    $300.00

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13. An application for registration of ti design shall be lodged at P O I ~ O ~
                                       TEE DESIGNS R u m , 1937

provisions.title: Section 14
provisions.content:
14. An application shall state the dass in which the designs is to
                be registered, and where it is desired to register the same design in
                more than one class. a separate application shall be made in resped
                of each class. In that case each application shall be numbered
                separately. and shall be treated as a separate and distinct application.

provisions.title: Section 15
provisions.content:
15. Every application shall state the article or articles to which the
2B2P"           design is to be applied and where the Registrar so requiree.
                the applicant shall further state for what purpose the article to which
                the design is to be applied is used and the material or the predominating
                material of which the article is made.
Statement of
novelty.          16. The applicant may. and &all if required by the Registrar
                in any case so to do, indorse on the application and each of the repre-
                sentations a brief statement of the novelty he claims for his design.
Rep-(I-           17. There shall be furnished in connection with an application for
tim.
                the registration of a design to be applied to a single article, three
                identical representations of the design, in a form satisfactory to the
                Registrar. or three specimens.
R-ta-             18. There shall be furnished in connection with an application for
tiom for act.
                the registration of a design to be applied to a set four identical

provisions.content:
30. Where an application for registration of a design is not completed

31. In case of the death of any applicant for the rtgistratjcm of

36. When the Registrar is satisfied as to the applicant's title -.

              information as can be afforded. Where Form Designs No. 12 is accom-
              panied by a representation or specimen of the design, such representa-
              tion or specimen shall be furnished in duplicate.

provisions.title: Section 43
provisions.content:
43. The Registrar may, upon application for the purpose
              made on Form Designs No. 13, cause a search to be made among
              the registered designs and state whether any design accompanying such
              form and to be applied to goods in any particular class appears to
              be identical with, or closely to resemble any registered design applied
              to such goods of which the copyright is still existing. The design
              accompanying Form Designs No. 13 shall be furnished in duplicate.

provisions.content:
47. Whenever the last day fixed by the Act ar by these Rules for
              doing any thing shall fall on a day when the &a is not open.

provisions.title: Section 49
provisions.content:
49. Before delivery on sale of any article to which a registered Registration
design has been applied, the proprietor of such design shall cause mark.
each such article to be marked with the word REGISTERED or with
the abbreviation REGD. or with the abbreviation RD. as he may
choose, and also with the number appearing on the certificate of
registration.

provisions.title: Section 50
provisions.content:
50. When a design is registered, there shall be entered in the Register, Registering
in addition to the particulars prescribed by the Act, such other partic-
ulan as the Registrar may deem necessary.

provisions.title: Section 51
provisions.content:
51. An application for the cancellation of the registration of a design Cancellation
under section 11 of the Act shall be made on Form Designs No. 15. Zf$~"O"
Such application shall be accompanied by an unstamped copy thereof :i",",'Pg?'
and a statement in duplicate setting out fully the nature of the compulsoryaeences under
applicant's interest and the facts upon which he bases his case and section         I I.

                                                                                Is'
the relief which he seeks. Copies of the application and the statement
of case will be transmitted by the Registrar to tht registered proprietor.

provisions.title: Section 52
provisions.content:
52. If the registered proprietor is desirous of opposing the applica-
tion, he shall, within 14 days of the receipt of such copies or such
further time as the Registrar may allow, leave at the office
a counter-statement fully setting out the grounds on which the applica-
tion is to be opposed and shall deliver to the applicant a copy thereof.

provisions.title: Section 53
provisions.content:
53. The applicant shall,within fourteen days from the delivery of such 2;'Zt''
copy or within such M e r h e as the Registrar may allow,
leave at the office evidence by way of a statutory declaration in support
of his case and shall deliver to the registered proprietor a copy thereof.

provisions.title: Section 54
provisions.content:
54. Within 14 days from the delivery of such copy or such further Proprietor's
time as the Registrar may allow, the proprietor may leave CV'dc"CC.
at the office statutory declarations in answer and, on so leaving, shall
deliver to the applicant a copy thereof and within fourteen days from

evidence.

provisions.title: Section 56
provisions.content:
56. On completion of the evidence, or at such other time as he may
               see fit, the Registrar shall appoint a time for the hearing
               of the case, and give the parties ten days' notice at least of such
               appointment, and in the event of his deciding to take evidence viva
               voce in lieu of, or in addition to, the evidence by declaration, or
               to allow any declarant to be cross-examined on his declaration, he
               may require the attendance of any declarant or other person whose
               evidence he may consider desirable. If either party does nor desire
               to be heard, he shall as soon as possible notify the Reatrat
               to that effen If either party desires to be h a r d he must give notice
Fonn DwUm      to the Registrar on Form Designs No. 16. The Registrar m y refuse
No. 16.
               to hear either party who has not left Form D     ew No. 16 prior to
               the date of the hearing.

provisions.title: Section 57
provisions.content:
57. In the event of an application for the cancelhtion of the registra-
               tion of a design b e i i uncontested by the proprietor, the Registwr
               in deciding whether costs should be awarded to the applicant
               shall consider whether proceedings might have been avoided if reason-
               able notice had been given by the applicant to the registered proprietor
               before the application was filed.
Lost              58. An application for a duplicate of a certificate of registration

No. 17.
